Title: Series: Old Testament Illustrations
Description: The Passover; six Israelites standing or sitting around a table in a dark room. On the table a plate with the roasted lamb and a loaf of bread. Here illustration to 'Chronica, Beschreybung und gemeyne anzeyge, Vonn aller Wellt herkommen....', Frankfurt: Christian Egenolph, 1535. 1533 Woodcut
Curator's comments: See Curatorial Comment for 1875,0710.275. The Israelites were commanded to be ready for their departure from Israel at short notice and asked to slay a lamb at sunset and mark their houses with the lamb's blood in order to be passed over when God would come to slay the firstborns.
Bibliographic references: Pauli 1901-11 / Hans Sebald Beham: Ein Kritisches Verzeichniss seiner Kupferstiche Radirungen und Holzschnitte (294)
Dodgson 1903, 1911 / Catalogue of Early German and Flemish Woodcuts in the BM, 2 vols (I.448.13)
Hollstein / German engravings, etchings and woodcuts c.1400-1700 (pp.166-7)
Associated titles: Chronica, Beschreybung und gemeyne anzeyge, Vonn aller Wellt herkommen
